definition[0]: when a factory, school, hospital etc has to close permanently
example[0]: Several military bases are threatened with closure.
example[2]: the closure of St Bartholomew’s Hospital
definition[1]: when a road, bridge etc is closed for a short time so that people cannot use it
example[3]: On the M40, there are lane closures near Oxford.
definition[2]: when an event or a period of time is brought to an end, or the feeling that something has been completely dealt with
example[4]: Funerals help give people a sense of closure.
definition[3]: the act of closing a factory, store, organization etc permanently
example[5]: The factory faces closure if no more money can be found.
example[6]: The company’s 50 high street stores are currently threatened with closure.
